comments.body: Wonder how much easier this would be (to read), if written in Dart...

Doesn't this also need a Windows version? We can't run bash scripts on Windows.

I second the suggestion to do all this in Dart, unless there's a reason we need to do this before we have downloaded the Dart toolchain.
This is not something I expect anyone to have to do. It's only there in case we need to repackage a new version of the wrapper. It's certainly not something an end-user would do.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@#!/bin/bash
